title: Fettuccine with Scallops
introduction: Experience the delightful combination of plump and sweet sea scallops with fresh fettuccine. This dish is complemented by the aromatic hints of garlic and basil, making it a delicious and elegant meal for any occasion. Using fresh ingredients ensures a burst of flavor with each bite, and it’s a versatile recipe that can be made with either sea or bay scallops.
ingredients: 1 pound sea scallops, cut into 1⁄2-inch pieces, or bay scallops, left whole
1 large ripe tomato, seeded and diced
2 cups fresh basil leaves, torn into 2 or 3 pieces
instructions: In a skillet large enough to hold all the pasta, cook the garlic in the oil over medium heat until the garlic is lightly golden, about 2 minutes. Stir in the scallops, pepper, and salt to taste. Cook just until the scallops are opaque, about 1 minute.
Stir in the tomato and basil. Cook 1 minute until the basil is slightly wilted. Remove the skillet from the heat.

Bring at least 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add 2 tablespoons of salt, then the pasta. Stir well. Cook over high heat, stirring frequently, until the pasta is al dente, tender yet still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta, reserving some of the cooking water.
Add the pasta to the skillet. Toss well, adding some of the cooking water if needed. Serve immediately.
